pronunciation: ORA'TION, [Latin oratio, from oro, to pray, to utter.]

definitions.text:
1. speech discourse composed according the rules of oratory, and spoken public. Orations may be reduced three kinds; demonstrative, deliberative, and judicial.
2. In modern usage, an oration differs sermon, an argument the bar, and speech before deliberative assembly. The word is now applied chiefly discourses pronounced special occasions, as funeral oration an oration some anniversary, etc. and academic declamations.
3. harangue; public speech address.
